tp.pr2

Class RobotEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • tp.pr2.RobotEngine

  • public class RobotEngine
extends java.lang.Object

    This class represents the robot engine. It controls robot movements by processing the instructions introduced with the keyboard. The engine stops when the robot arrives at the space ship, runs out of fuel or receives a quit instruction.

    The robot engine is also responsible for updating the fuel level and the recycled material according to the actions that the robot performs in the city.

    The robot engine also contains an inventory where the robot stores the items that it collects from the city

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RobotEngine(City cityMap, Place initialPlace, Direction dir)
      Creates the robot engine in an initial place, facing an initial direction and with a city map.

      Returns the current fuel level of the robot.
      Street getHeadingStreet()
      Returns the street opposite the robot
      int getRecycledMaterial()
      Returns the current weight of recycled material that the robot carries.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RobotEngine

        public RobotEngine(City cityMap,
           Place initialPlace,
           Direction dir)
        Creates the robot engine in an initial place, facing an initial direction and with a city map. Initially the robot has not any items or recycled material but it has an initial amount of fuel (50).
        Parameters:
        cityMap - The city where the robot wanders
        initialPlace - The place where the robot starts
        direction - The initial direction where the robot is facing.

    • Method Detail

      • startEngine

        public void startEngine()
        It starts the robot engine. Basically, it reads a line, the interpreter generates the corresponding instruction and executes it. The simulation finishes when the robot arrives at the space ship, the user types "QUIT", or the robot runs out of fuel

      • addFuel

        public void addFuel(int fuel)
        Adds an amount of fuel to the robot (it can be negative)
        Parameters:
        fuel - Amount of fuel added to the robot

      • addRecycledMaterial

        public void addRecycledMaterial(int weight)
        Increases the amount of recycled material of the robot
        Parameters:
        weight - Amount of recycled material

      • getFuel

        public int getFuel()
        Returns the current fuel level of the robot. This method is mandatory FOR TESTING PURPOSES
        Returns:
        The current fuel level of the robot

      • getRecycledMaterial

        public int getRecycledMaterial()
        Returns the current weight of recycled material that the robot carries. This method is mandatory FOR TESTING PURPOSES
        Returns:
        The current recycled material of the robot

      • getHeadingStreet

        public Street getHeadingStreet()
        Returns the street opposite the robot
        Returns:
        The street which the robot is facing, or null, if there is not any street in this direction
